org.linqs.psl.database.rdbms

Class RDBMSDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.linqs.psl.database.Database
      • org.linqs.psl.database.rdbms.RDBMSDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReadableDatabase, WritableDatabase

    public class RDBMSDatabase
extends Database
    A view on the datastore with specific partitions activated. Keep in mind that the upstream datstore/driver usere a connection pool and we should close out connections and statements after we are done with them.

    • Method Detail

      • getAtom

        public GroundAtom getAtom(Predicate predicate,
                          Constant... arguments)
        Description copied from interface: ReadableDatabase
        Returns the GroundAtom for the given Predicate and GroundTerms. Any GroundAtom with a StandardPredicate can be retrieved if and only if its Predicate was registered with the DataStore at the time of the Database's instantiation. Any GroundAtom with an ExternalFunctionalPredicate} can also be retrieved. This method first checks the AtomCache to see if the GroundAtom already exists in memory. If it does, then that object is returned. If the GroundAtom does not exist in memory, then it will be instantiated and stored in the AtomCache before being returned. The subtype and state of the instantiated GroundAtom depends on several factors:
        • If the GroundAtom is persisted in a read Partition, then it will be instantiated as an ObservedAtom with the persisted state.
        • If the GroundAtom is persisted in the write Partition, then it will be instantiated with the persisted state. It will be instantiated as an ObservedAtom if its Predicate is closed and as a RandomVariableAtom if it is open.
        • If the GroundAtom has a StandardPredicate but is not persisted in any of the Database's partitions, it will be instantiated with a truth value of 0.0. It will be instantiated as an ObservedAtom if its Predicate is closed and as a RandomVariableAtom if it is open.
        • If the GroundAtom has an ExternalFunctionalPredicate, then it will be instantiated as an ObservedAtom with the functionally defined truth value.

      • deleteAtom

        public boolean deleteAtom(GroundAtom atom)
        Description copied from interface: WritableDatabase
        Removes the GroundAtom from the Database, if it exists.

      • commit

        public void commit(Collection<RandomVariableAtom> atoms)
        Description copied from interface: WritableDatabase
        A batch form or commit(). When possible, this commit should be used.

      • commit

        public void commit(Collection<RandomVariableAtom> atoms,
                   int partitionId)
        Description copied from interface: WritableDatabase
        A form of commit() that allows the caller to choose the specific partition the atoms are comitted to. Should only be used if you REALLY know what you are doing.

      • moveToWritePartition

        public void moveToWritePartition(StandardPredicate predicate,
                                 int oldPartitionId)
        Description copied from interface: WritableDatabase
        Move all ground atoms of a predicate/partition combination into the write partition. Be careful not to call this while the database is in use.

      • executeGroundingQuery

        public ResultList executeGroundingQuery(Formula formula)
        Description copied from interface: ReadableDatabase
        Like executeQuery(), but specifically for grounding queries. This will use extra optimizations.

      • executeQuery

        public ResultList executeQuery(DatabaseQuery query)
        Description copied from interface: ReadableDatabase
        Returns all groundings of a Formula that match a DatabaseQuery.

      • executeQuery

        public ResultList executeQuery(Map<Variable,Integer> projectionMap,
                               VariableTypeMap varTypes,
                               String queryString)
        A more general form for executeQuery().
        Parameters:
        projectionMap - a mapping of each variable we want returned to the order it appears in the select statement.
        varTypes - the types for each variable in the projection.
        queryString - the SQL query.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed(StandardPredicate predicate)
        Description copied from interface: ReadableDatabase
        Returns whether a StandardPredicate is closed in this Database.

        Description copied from interface: WritableDatabase
